headline: Verizon Business impresses at latest ‘Innovation Session’
summary: Customers were treated to an in-depth look at Verizon’s networking capabilities with emphasis on 5G network slicing, global IoT, next-generation wireless, and cybersecurity.

headline: Verizon and Chicago Bears Partner to Provide $2 Million in Medical Debt Relief for Illinois Veterans
summary: CHICAGO, Sept. 22, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Verizon Great Lakes and the Chicago Bears today announced a partnership to provide $2 million in medical debt relief specifically for Illinois veterans, as part of Verizon's groundbreaking $22 million commitment to eliminate crushing medical debt for veterans across the Great Lakes region through 2026. This initiative targets the crushing weight of medical debt—a significant burden that disproportionately affects veterans transitioning to civilian life

headline: Visible, Verizon's Leading Digital-First Wireless Brand, Makes In-Store Retail Debut at Best Buy
summary: NEW YORK, September 22, 2025--Starting today, Visible, the digital-first wireless carrier powered by Verizon's network, is now available on BestBuy.com. In-store availability at Best Buy locations nationwide will begin September 28. This expansion allows customers to maintain the streamlined, app-based experience that has made Visible a favorite among tech-savvy users while adding the option to visit a physical location for immediate needs like SIM cards or device compatibility checks.

headline: T-Mobile names veteran Srini Gopalan as CEO to steer strategy amid fierce competition
summary: (Reuters) -T-Mobile said on Monday insider Srinivasan Gopalan would take over as CEO from Mike Sievert on November 1, marking a leadership transition as the telecom company works to defend its 5G lead in a saturated U.S. wireless market.  The industry has also witnessed significant consolidation in recent years, exemplified by T-Mobile's $26 billion merger with Sprint in 2020.  When asked about future M&A, Gopalan told Reuters that the company is now focused on investing in the spectrum and fiber business.

When asked about future M&A, Gopalan told Reuters that the company is now focused on investing in the spectrum and fiber business.
